intro: Corothamnus myrtifolius, commonly known as the redstem flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has aromatic, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Corothamnus myrtifolius is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
